title: Layover tours get you out of the airport and into the city
text:
CLOSE

You don't need to spend a long layover holed up in a passenger lounge. Some airports offer free or low-cost local tours to connecting passengers. “If you have a five- or six-hour layover, you can easily see several things,” said Brendan Dorsey of The Points Guy, a site devoted to traveling on points and miles. “You don’t have to plan a lot. Everything’s just kind of set up for you.” Some tours have fees, and it’s important to check on visa requirements. Dorsey shares some favorites with Larry Bleiberg for USA TODAY.

Incheon Airport, South Korea

South Korea’s main airport makes it simple to visit the capital city of Seoul. Passengers can tour temples, caves and palaces, or even sign up for downtown shopping. “You only need a couple hours,” Dorsey says. “It’s a stress-free way to see the city.” airport.kr

Istanbul Airport

Istanbul recently opened a new $12 billion airport, but continues a long tradition of free tours for passengers on its flagship airline, Turkish Airlines. The excursions, available to those with at least a six-hour layover, hit top historic districts and offer a chance to sample Turkish food. “You can do a lot in six hours. There’s so much history,” Dorsey says. Passengers with a layover of more than 20 hours may even be eligible for a free hotel stay. turkishairlines.com

Salt Lake City International Airport

Located just 5 miles from downtown, Salt Lake City’s airport makes for an easy layover. Your best bet is a free 45-minute tour of Temple Square, provided by the Mormon Church. If you have longer, there’s a chance to visit the Family History Library, the church gardens and several historic buildings. The church recently discontinued its free airport shuttle service, but it’s still just a quick Uber ride away. templesquare.com

Narita Airport, Japan

With just a few hours in Japan, you still have time to dress up like a samurai or ninja on one of several English-speaking excursions offered by the airport. Along with a cosplay visit to a historic theme park, visitors can tour temples, take a nature hike or sample a homestyle Japanese meal. Tours are free but don’t include the cost of public transportation or entrance fees. narita-transit-program.jp

Lisbon Airport, Portugal

Passengers on TAP Air Portugal have the option of scheduling a stopover of up to five days if they’re connecting to another flight on the airline. The option is also available for passengers flying through Porto’s airport. “It’s really easy to do it on their website,” Dorsey says. For shorter stopovers, Lisbon’s airport is close to downtown, and easily reached by public transportation. flytap.com

Taoyuan International Airport, Taiwan

If your layover lasts from seven to 24 hours, you’re eligible for free tours of the island. Passengers can store their bags at the airport, freeing them up to take their choice of two half-day city tours provided by the Taiwan Tourism Bureau. Tours can be booked on arrival but often fill up, making reservations advisable. eng.taiwan.net.tw

Los Angeles International Airport

While not an official airport offering, those with long layovers at LAX can get a private tour of the city for $96. The excursion offers airport pickup and drop-off, and visits the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Santa Monica and the Hollywood sign, and includes a lunch stop at the Farmers Market. lacitytours.com

Keflavík Airport, Iceland

For decades, Icelandair has lured travelers to its home country by offering free stopovers. It’s easy to experience the country’s famed Blue Lagoon hot spring pool and spa, which is only 20 minutes from the airport and connected with regular bus service. “It’s a great way to relax,” Dorsey says. destinationbluelagoon.is

Hamad International Airport, Doha, Qatar

Doha is a fascinating city – and easy to explore on a layover tour available to Qatar Airways passengers. “There’s a lot of stuff to see. They have some really beautiful architecture,” Dorsey says. The three-hour excursion includes visits to the Museum of Islamic Art, the Pearl-Qatar man-made island and the Souq Waqif. qatarairways.com

Changi Airport Singapore

Although Singapore’s airport is often ranked the world’s best, it’s still worth leaving for a free city tour. A heritage excursion, which visits Chinatown and Little India, is available for layovers of at least 5 1/2 hours, while those with six hours between flights can take a city highlights tour visiting the Marina Bay Financial Center and the Singapore Flyer Ferris wheel. “It’s a great city to visit,” Dorsey says. changiairport.com
